required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Pregnancy and Childbirth on Pelvic Floor Morphology and Sexual Function in Egyptian Women
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Pregnancy and Parturition on Pelvic Floor Morphology and Sexual Function in Egyptian Women.

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate levator ani muscle morphology following normal vaginal delivery and cesarean section (elective and emergent), using three-dimensional (3D) transperineal ultrasound, and to study the effect of mode of delivery on female sexual function.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound applied for the submitted 120 women "primiparae" (40 women after normal vaginal delivery), (40 women after urgent cesarean section), (40 women after elective cesarean section), in early postpartum period (48 to 72) hours postpartum, to evaluate levator ani morphology.
2. answering of the validated female sexual function index (F.S.F.I) three months postpartum period for same cases submitted to ultrasound.

primary_outcome.measure: Pelvic floor muscle strength as assessed by three/four dimensional translabial pelvic floor ultrasound
primary_outcome.time_frame: early postpartum period (48 to 72) hours postpartum

primary_outcome.measure: Sexual function of pelvic floor as assessed by the validated female sexual function index

secondary_outcome.measure: Trauma or avulsion of levator ani muscle as assessed by three/four dimensional translabial pelvic floor ultrasound
Sexual function as assessed by the validated female sexual function index

arm_group.description: (40 women after normal vaginal delivery) submitted to transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound 48-72 hours postpartum.
(40 women after urgent cesarean section) submitted to transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound 48-72 hours postpartum.
(40 women after elective cesarean section) submitted to transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound 48-72 hours postpartum.

intervention.description: Transperineal pelvic floor ultrasound applied for the submitted 120 women "primiparae" (40 women after normal vaginal delivery), (40 women after urgent cesarean section), (40 women after elective cesarean section), in early postpartum period (48 to 72) hours postpartum, to evaluate levator ani morphology.

study_pop.textblock: primiparae in early postpartum period (48 hours to72 hours). written consent was taken. easy communicable, reachable women for further requirements.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primiparae in early postpartum period (48 hours to72 hours). written consent was taken. easy communicable, reachable women for further requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Refused consent.
2. Previous vaginal or cesarean delivery.
3. Severe mental illness.
4. Severe physical handicap or difficulties in communication.
5. Women without postpartum active sexual life or separate from their spouse.
6. Past history of sexual dysfunction.
